transcript.text: Select Gift or Entertainment for each of these examples, then click on Submit.

contentText.text: See if you can recognize whether each example counts as a gift or entertainment.

instructionText.text: Select Gift or Entertainment for each option then click on Submit.
Click on Next (bottom right arrow) to continue.

option.img: Employees at a team meal with a supplier
option.text: A supplier invites the entire project team to a meal to celebrate the end of a big project
A customer gives you a voucher for a massage at a local resort as a "thank you" for your work
You are attending a trade show on behalf of the company and the organizers invite attendees to an evening event
A supplier offers to pay for your team’s meal at a local restaurant after an on-site meeting, but the supplier won’t be attending
A supplier invites you to a sporting event, but feels ill and tells you to go without her

correct.text: Different rules apply when it comes to reporting gifts and entertainment. Remember that the giver shares in the benefit when it is entertainment – they attend the dinner, they go to the event too, etc.
A supplier inviting the team to a meal or attending a trade show evening event is entertainment, since both provide opportunities to discuss business and the giver shares in the benefit.
A gift certificate, and events where the giver won’t be at the invited event, are considered gifts.
